website_summaries.verdict: A rugged pair that is strong enough to hold up to numerous jobs and easy to store and take along.
pros: An all-steel sawhorse that comes assembled
Garners praise for how easy they are to maneuver – folding design is simple to operate
capacity each, 36" length and 3 1/2" work surface
cons: Though they have a solid build that most owners rave about, a few found them top-heavy for some tasks
A bit shorter than other models we considered

customer_reviews.title: weak
customer_reviews.text: These had good reviews, but Im not sure why. I am a teacher and I purchased these for our construction class and they are not built to last. I had these for a month now, and the legs don't stay out, the locking system is ruined. These are very weakly built. Not worth buying if you are looking for saw horses to last
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are mostly great with a few exceptions
customer_reviews.text: These are mostly great with a few exceptions. Great height, sturdy under lots of weight. I ordered two pairs of these a couple of years ago and just recently ordered a few more sets. The new sets seem to be the same build quality but are now two-tone grey and a yellow-orange. The product photos on here need to be updated to match the new version. Photo posted is of the new sawhorses (with the old version behind them). I would give them 4-stars without that (sometimes they don't sit flat until you kick the legs out farther and put enough weight on them). But I'm knocking off 1 star for the fact that they don't match the photos.
customer_reviews.author: enh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a portable option, lightweight, sturdy, good value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a gift for my fiancé who is in construction. We own a home remodeling company. You do want to add the wood to the top as some have suggested. This helps to steady them. Be sure the wood is very straight or it will cause them to be unsteady. Another reviewer mentioned he thought he had an issue with his and realized it was directly because of the boards he attached being slightly warped. They are easy to use and great for a portable option. An actual handle would be nice, but you can easily grab the legs to carry. Happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Cali

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool, compact when stowed and sturdy enough for ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tool, compact when stowed and sturdy enough for my use. Topped with sacrificial 2x4's and went to work with them -- immediately improving my sheet stock and long stock cut-down operations from day one. The units seems solid and I expect with a bit of gentleness they will last a long time, but the 5th star is withheld because the hardware for extending and retracting the legs feels right at the engineered threshold - no extra tolerance. If that hardware was a bit more robust, these would be a life-time solution.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty set of sawhorses.
customer_reviews.text: I install garage doors for a living. I regularly set 200-1000 pounds of material on two sawhorses. As you might imagine, the sawhorses on my work vehicle must be rock solid. These fit the bill! These are heavy duty enough, while still keeping their weight relatively low. They fold up into fairly compact units for transport. I also like the bright orange color, much more difficult to leave behind in somebody's messy garage!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tall and well made, compact design.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my daughter because I was flying to help her with renovations on her new home. These fold up well and are easy to unfold too. Before you buy them check the height because they are tall. I'm 5'-11" and they are even tall for me to swing my leg up to hold lumber while cutting. Since purchasing them I've visited her a couple times to work on renos and enjoy pulling these out to hold my work.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Novak

customer_reviews.title: Design concern
customer_reviews.text: I received the Bora sawhorses a few days ago. The design is a concern. There is some wobble side to side. In addition, the cross-bar section is stamped metal and both of mine are slightly bowed to one side. There are OK for the money spent. If you want long lasting quality you should plan to spend more than what these costs.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Boord

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Have these for about 8 months now and the yellow paint on the legs is flaking off. Every time I fold/unfold them, more and more of the yellow paint comes off in LARGE pieces. Soon there will be no paint left on them! They are not being mishandled or banged around. Just touching the legs causes the paint to come off. Will end up having to sand them down, primer and paint them myself to prevent them from rusting!!! DO NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Nice sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pair of sawhorses. I used 2X6 for the top board.this worked out nicely. It gives you a bit of room to clamp whatever you need up there to sand or cut. A 2x8 might have been a bit better for clamping. but you will lose a little room when you store them. also go a couple inches longer on each end to help with clamping and sturdiness. The folding legs are the best for storage. I really like these horses
customer_reviews.author: Trebbleshooter

customer_reviews.title: The bright orange is very happy and modern in my office
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as legs for a large worktable, and they are fabulous. Strong and sleek. The bright orange is very happy and modern in my office. The carpenter who installed my table was skeptical at first, but then very impressed with how sturdy they've turned out to be. Highly recommend as an inexpensive way to make a large desk or work area.
customer_reviews.author: Linnie Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Fourth time a charm.
customer_reviews.text: These are my fourth try at finding sturdy folding saw horses. Collapsing, shaky, foldimg when I didn't want them to fold, describes all the others. These came assembled, the only thing needed was to put them to work. Push a button, a leg unfolds, ready for work. Push again for storage. Their sturdiness when opened, gave me full confidence I wouldn't be picking my job up off the floor. When folded there was no annoying rattle. I'm about to search to see what other products these folks sell, and I'll probably be buying a second pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Unsafe and Totally Useless from Factory
customer_reviews.text: Whoever put these together did not rivet the entire side of one of the saw horses. Amazon sold me junk.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Solid and stable
customer_reviews.text: A pair of these are currently holding up my 1,500#+ truck camper. I added some 2x4s to the top and cranked down the camper onto them. Stable enough for me to move around inside the camper without fear of tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: TheChinaman

customer_reviews.title: Stable sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: Very strong sawhorses and fold nicely, however, the legs are supposed to fold flat, but it allows 1 or 2 of the legs to open slightly (1 or 2 inches) which can be an issue if you are trying to store them in a tight area. However, I would buy them again as they are very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Don Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loved it
customer_reviews.text: My hubby is always saying I could fix this if only I had this.. so I started listening and when he said I need to rebuild the shed door but I have no saw horses well I got them and they worked out perfectly He was thrilled that he didn't have to put them together and storage is easy peasy
customer_reviews.author: Martie K

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid?
customer_reviews.text: Lots of play in the legs and the top material is fairly thin gauge and quite flexible. Feet are hard plastic and so they slide across smooth floors with minimal resistance. All in all, these are sloppier and flimsier than I would expect. Not a terrible deal for the price, but a far cry from "rock solid".
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'Leary

customer_reviews.title: The best saw horse's I have ever owned and I have ...
customer_reviews.text: The best saw horse's I have ever owned and I have own more than a few over the years. Strong, sturdy, and have a really great lock-in-place-position. Had a pair almost like these years ago but they didn't fold up all the way like these do and I got a few mashed fingers trying to get them folded up for storage. Plus they weighed a ton. Happy with these
customer_reviews.author: close2right

customer_reviews.title: Well built product
customer_reviews.text: I like the height and sturdiness of the horses, and the provision for fastening 2x stock to the tops. These horses are great for creating a "work table" adjacent to my PM4000 miter saw stand.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome saw horse immediately after it came out the package I realized that it was sturdy and solid and can last a lifetime if taken care of. It's quite heavy however it can fold and be stored in a small area. In comparison to other sawhorses I've seen at hardware stores this is the most solid one that I can trust with holding my equipment. This is also a very good bargain for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Aplus

customer_reviews.title: Excellant product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy peasy, nice and easy. No way would I create wooden ones over these for use in home shop etc.
customer_reviews.author: boeyc15

customer_reviews.title: Good for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved these today via UPS....Package/Box was destroyed "as usual" from UPS Thank goodness these are made of steel.These look like they will do the job.I'm an around the house handyman and not a big time construction expert by any means.Had to dig one of the pop out holders for one leg with a screw driver.No big deal.Made in China..so what else is new.I guess you get what you pay for.Love the color Orange as Im a Harley guy.I would recommend for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Charlane Valade

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: The metal is thin but for the money is good you need to add 2x4 along the top for strength n they’re light n handy.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin G. Chatfield

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a quality pair of saw horses, these are it! Very well made and design. Sturdy and I'm sure to have for a long time. Definitely worth checking out.
customer_reviews.author: Don Miles

customer_reviews.title: They are easy to unfold and/or fold
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to unfold and/or fold, take almost no space if folded to store them away. Screwed a 2x4 on top with three drywall screws from underneath, that makes it easy to change them if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank L.

customer_reviews.title: Saw horses
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to cut 8 foot boards and have an area to stay in the boards. These are quality saw horses yet store away easily. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria McGrath

customer_reviews.title: These sawhorses are rock solid and appear to be sturdy. The great thing about them is that they ...
customer_reviews.text: These sawhorses are rock solid and appear to be sturdy. The great thing about them is that they are pretty light, fold up and can be easily stored. In a home workshop where storage space is at a premium, these are a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: ff5605

customer_reviews.title: Very strong vertically. Not so much laterally. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very strong vertically. Not so much laterally. I bent a leg beyond repair by trying to climb up it. Wasn't an issue on our old aluminum saw horses but that's the price you pay for the compactness of these when folded up. I would buy again but I would be more careful next time. They're not a step ladder haha. Don't forget to add a 2x4 on top so you don't cut them by mistake!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Francis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These are nice horses. Expensive but well built. Add a 1x4 or 2x4 to the tops for protection & added stability. I recommend for the home shop, not the job site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stayed outdoor for weeks and nothing happened to it
customer_reviews.text: Very light to move around. And I left it out in my drive way for weeks and they still look new.
customer_reviews.author: Solid Lee

customer_reviews.title: Received in good shape, it's a heavy package
customer_reviews.text: Received in good shape, it's a heavy package. Couldn't be happier with them. Already used them and really worked well. With proper care they should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: ZSN

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: I use them in my shop/ barn for holding welding projects they work good for me I'm not folding or moving them much
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Waited too long to open up package
customer_reviews.text: with all the great reviews I thought nothing about not opening until I needed them. I bought these to hold up a piano while I restored it. These things are junk and I waited too long to open the package. now I guess that I am stuck with a horrible product from Amazon. Stay away from this product. or at the very least open it up when you first get it
customer_reviews.author: FHG

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: I like these sawhorses because they are sturdy yet reasonably light weight. They collapse easily.
customer_reviews.author: ThosRM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy once 2 by's attached ,,fold out of way nicely. Plenty strong for most every thing I do...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small projects. Have used it to paint kitchen cabinet doors and shelves.
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Grossman

customer_reviews.title: Good, stable horse
customer_reviews.text: Added a length of 2x4 to each horse, and it firmed them up nicely. Very stable once opened up. Easy to store. Good value. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: I only wish I had seen them years ago and not wasted money and the cheaper ones which are not of ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the strongest and nicest horses I have used in my construction work. I only wish I had seen them years ago and not wasted money and the cheaper ones which are not of good quality. As the old saying goes " buy cheap and you will buy twice" . If you buy a set you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Rand

customer_reviews.title: Highly Functional and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: These sawhorses are well designed, and work beautifully. I've used them many times at this point, and they work well, are nicely balanced, stable, sturdy, easy to open/close, and their compactness when closed makes them easy to store. Plus the holes in the top for attaching 2x4s (which I did) are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy stands and they fold for easy storage. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. Good packaging, easy to use, very sturdy, folds and packs away nice.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for heavy duty saw horses that can be used by professional construction work crew. NO WAY!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maresca

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, high quality, best ones we could find after an extensive search.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw horses as soon as you add a 2x4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great saw horses as soon as you add a 2x4 to the top of them otherwise they seem a little flimsy. 1 year review- after the first year one of the pins is missing for a leg and metal is slowly bending out of shape, also I need to tighten the nuts and bolts regularly to keep them in working order.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Harris

customer_reviews.title: They are ok
customer_reviews.text: They are reasonably sturdy. I like being able to add a piece of wood to make them as wide as desired
customer_reviews.author: david unnerstall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, came fully assembled.
customer_reviews.text: Love! Easy to fold and put away. Used to paint interior doors.
customer_reviews.author: jmcbeath

customer_reviews.title: flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Legs are stout enough, but the top is very lightweight and easily bends out of shape. They were good enough for one job, but they'll be in the next dumpster on the next job.
customer_reviews.author: david gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great saw horses
customer_reviews.text: Dependable, sturdy and very convenient. This purchase is my 2nd pair of these folding saw horses.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: arrived slightly damaged but nothing worse than i was going to do with it anyways,
customer_reviews.author: Ted Noodle

customer_reviews.title: Best value for quality sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: What a deal for two steel sawhorses. These are heavy duty sawhorses for the price of those cheap plastic ones! I cut 2x4s and screwed them into the top face for more grip and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Socrates

customer_reviews.title: Folding Sawhorses
customer_reviews.text: The sawhorses are a quality product and work well as described.
customer_reviews.author: JeffrySS

customer_reviews.title: Package had one end smashed. The end pieces of ...
customer_reviews.text: Package had one end smashed. The end pieces of the sawhorses are poorly painted. The paint is pealing right off. This started before items were delivered. Solid sawhorses I Would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: stephen j andersen

customer_reviews.title: Solid and compact. Got tired of using cheaply made ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid and compact. Got tired of using cheaply made plastic and metal horses so these work perfectly for my general carpentry needs.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Industrial Table Legs
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great for semi-permanent workspaces. Looks professional enough for an office, yet durable enough to support several hundred pound workloads (and computer monitors).
customer_reviews.author: hilljacquard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, heavy duty set. Easy to fold, excellent work height.
customer_reviews.author: Romanis W Radzins

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, and folds up neatly, time will tell if they go the distance.
customer_reviews.author: Latreenbeast

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these saw horses....folds up when not in use....worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: edward L conklin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold, easy to mount a 2x4 on top, and so strong even I can't seem to kill them. Only one thing I might complain about is they are heavy, but unless you buy titanium the weight comes with the strength. They seem indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: lewweingarth

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These fairly light-weight, collapsable metal sawhorses are ideal for my small workshop as they can handle a variety of tasks and stow away in a small footprint when not in use. After attaching a 2x4 to the top w/ six 1"x10 wood screws they are sturdy under load with very little flex, the small amount of flex allows the legs to self-level over uneven surfaces. The bright orange finish is a high quality, durable powder-coat paint that should withstand anything you throw at it. I've researched several models/types and I'm very pleased with this one, particularly its strength and easy fold.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made for the price. Opens up very easily and is very sturdy. I don't think I would use them fro a platform to stand on but they are very good for a work platform.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A.Goulet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. My guys love it. Great set of saw horses for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe V.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend !!
customer_reviews.text: These saw horses are very well made and heavy duty. They are a little heavy buy they will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Sweeps90

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to fold. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: chris kulczycki

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my jeep restoration project, have the body tub sitting on these and they're very stable as im doing the body work.
customer_reviews.author: Parothed11

customer_reviews.title: these bad boys can hold some serious weight effortlessly and safely
customer_reviews.text: worth every penny. build a work station anywhere. these bad boys can hold some serious weight effortlessly and safely.
customer_reviews.author: bun

customer_reviews.title: these are great. Very solidly made and the legs fold up ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the professionals but as a homeowner who needs a couple sawhorses around for various projects every couple weeks to a month, these are great. Very solidly made and the legs fold up when not in use. I had been worried about the chance of collapsing but with a pin to lock in place, no longer even have to think of that. I went ahead and added cut 2 x 4's to each top railing and the holes had already been drilled. These are perfect for my purposes and i'll never even get close to exceeding their weight limits.
customer_reviews.author: George Madden

customer_reviews.title: Steel part is fine, but feel unstable
customer_reviews.text: Steel part is fine, but feel unstable. There are other true construction options that seem better. Might be nice for tables.
customer_reviews.author: rcff

customer_reviews.title: The saw horses are very stable.
customer_reviews.text: I am a welder and have built several saw horses in my time but I have never built any that would fold up. When I found these I thought you know I could build these. When I got thinking about it I said I'll bet they are flimsy cause I know the ones I would build would not be. I was truly surprised when they arrived at how sturdy they are and how compact. I have recently went back to try and get a second set and the only way I can find them is single, bring the two pack back.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Corley

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a really nice set but it's just to over priced .
customer_reviews.author: deere2210

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, exceeded my expectations. No assembly required! Just unfold the legs and go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg M.

customer_reviews.title: These are almost too heavy for a portable product, ...
customer_reviews.text: These are almost too heavy for a portable product, but it is difficult to complain about something built so robustly. They fold perfectly and are impressive in every way. There is not much else to say about such a simple and elegant product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conley

customer_reviews.title: This Portamate PM-ee00T Saw Horse, 2 Pack, is great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Portamate PM-3300T Saw Horse, 2 Pack for my husband. He needed something that could be very sturdy and dependable. This is both and I feel good because they are safe and easily collapsed for storage. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Steel Saw Horses arrived damaged!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought about 30 steel saw horses over the years and these appear to be well made. I'd give it 5 stars for the product but had been damaged in shipping but I needed them "now" so I bent the ends back into shape. The box that they came in looked trashed and had been dropped on the end to where the legs on the bad end would not even open.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Larsen

customer_reviews.title: High hopes, but highly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews often, but these saw horses compelled me. They're awful. They made me angry every time I used them. The little spring-loaded buttons that hold the legs open or closed were insufficient, and the legs would collapse shut if you shifted weight the wrong way, which can cause a dangerous or damaging situation. Or if you slid something across them their narrow stance would let them tip over easily. I recently got to the breaking point and threw these in the dumpster. I've yet to find the ideal saw horse, but I advise everyone to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Teague Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was fine however the bunk on one side of the saw ...
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was fine however the bunk on one side of the saw horse was riveted together crooked causing the horse to be twisted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bent, Rusted and Shipping Package Destroyed
customer_reviews.text: probably pretty good, but the box was destroyed, the product was bent (looks like its REALLY hard to do) and the product was heavily rusted in the compromised joint, meaning this was bent and rusting before it went out for delivery. not happy about this purchase due to the shipping conditions. Completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Keegan Klauke

customer_reviews.title: this horse is a piece of crap. its defective
customer_reviews.text: this horse is a piece of crap. its defective . i want my money back including the delivery charges. WILL ASK FOR MY MONEY BACK FROM THE CREDIT CARD SERVICE.
customer_reviews.author: JO ANTONY

product_meta.title: Bora Portamate PM-3300T Steel Folding Sawhorses – Set of 2 Heavy Duty Stands – Pre-Assembled, Orange, 33"
product_meta.description: Here’s a set of two of our Portamate PM-3300 sawhorses (the “T” in PM3300T stands for “Two”). That means you are getting a pair of all steel, heavy duty, rock solid folding sawhorses that will make all of your DIY or professional projects easy. A stable, solid work surface is paramount for good work, and these will provide you that, and when you’re finished, will fold right up for easy storage. Fully assembled, you can use these sawhorses right out of the box – just unfold the legs, use the locking pin to lock them into place, and that’s it. The quality will be apparent, with one-inch heavy gauge tubular steel legs, and a powder coated, rust-resistant finish. And because this is a pair, you’re getting a 1,000lb weight capacity, so go ahead and do the heavy work – these sawhorses can take it. You can also attach a 2x4 or 2x6 wood top to each one (they are pre-drilled to accept this). Comes complete with a one year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: ONE-HORSE RACE - Whether you’re a professional carpenter or a weekend DIY’er, you’ll appreciate Bora Portamate Sawhorse’s lightweight, compact design, durable all-steel construction, and foldable legs for easy storage. Our heavy duty saw horses are the ones that you can bet on to get any job done quickly and efficiently.

SIZE MATTERS – Each sawhorse has a top that measures 39” x 3. 5” with a comfortable 33” work height, and a wide, stable 29” x 48” stance. Each sawhorse has a 500 lb maximum weight capacity and can support a total of 1, 000 lbs when both are used together.

NO ASSEMBLY NEEDED - At Bora Portamate, we know that you’ve got enough on your plate already with your construction or home improvement projects. That’s why our sawhorses come pre-assembled and ready to use. Just open the box, unfold the legs, lock them into place, and you can get to work.

RIDE BAREBACK OR NOT – The steel tops can be used, or you can quickly mount a 2” x 4” or 2” x 6” wood piece to using the convenient pre-drilled holes. Its rust-resistant powder coat provides a tough finish for an extended life.

DON’T PUT THE CART BEFORE THE HORSE – You know how the saying goes, but in this case, you can put the horse in your cart and buy with confidence. This Sawhorse set is backed by a 1-year to make your purchase worry-free.
